alert.note: Alert for Schuylkill (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 9:27PM EST until January 11 at 5:18AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EST WEDNESDAY... ...REPLACES FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Dauphin, Lancaster, Lebanon, Perry, Schuylkill and York. * WHEN...Until 400 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Streams continue to rise quickly due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. Local emergency officials have reported water rescues. It will take several hours for all the water to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 923 PM EST, rain and snowmelt is occurring, and is causing flooding. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. The heaviest rain is ending, but light additional showers are possible tonight. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.1 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lancaster, Harrisburg, York, Lebanon, Landingville, Hanover, Pottsville, Hershey, Ephrata, Elizabethtown, Millersville, Camp Hill, Willow Street and Mount Joy. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
